body:
@theStack thanks for detailed review and suggestions.
They really simplified the code. I added you as co-author.
I'd maybe suggest naming this mempool_datacarrier.py.
diff_hunk:
@@ -320,6 +320,7 @@
     'feature_unsupported_utxo_db.py',
     'feature_logging.py',
     'feature_anchors.py',
+    'feature_datacarrier.py',

body:
`data = b"Hello world!" * 7` would have worked just as well here.

I'd recommend making these values just above the limits to detect off-by-one errors. For example, instead of composing it of "hello world" strings, use a `MAX_OP_RETURN_RELAY`-length string.
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020-2021 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test datacarrier functionality"""
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_RETURN,
+)
+from test_framework.wallet import (
+    MiniWallet
+)
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    CTxOut,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_raises_rpc_error,
+)
+
+class DataCarrierTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def test_transaction(self, tx, success):
+        tx_hex = tx.serialize().hex()
+
+        if success:
+            self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+            assert(tx.rehash() in self.nodes[0].getrawmempool(True))
+        else:
+            assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, "scriptpubkey", self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+
+    def create_null_data_transaction(self, script):
+        tx = self.wallet.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0)["tx"]
+        tx.vout.append(CTxOut(nValue=0, scriptPubKey=script))
+        tx.vout[0].nValue -= tx.get_vsize()  # simply pay 1sat/vbyte fee
+        return tx
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.node = self.nodes[0]
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.wallet.rescan_utxos()
+
+        self.log.info("Testing null data transaction with default -datacarrier and -datacarriersize values.")
+        script = CScript([OP_RETURN, b"Hello world!"])
+        tx = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx, success=True)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction larger than allowed by the default -datacarriersize value.")
+        data = b"Hello world!" * 10

body: Concept ACK

nit (feel free to ignore)
```suggestion
        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.node)
```

from test_framework.messages import CTxOut
from test_framework.script import CScript, OP_RETURN

from test_framework.util import assert_raises_rpc_error
from test_framework.wallet import MiniWallet

@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020-2021 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test datacarrier functionality"""
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_RETURN,
+)
+from test_framework.wallet import (
+    MiniWallet
+)
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    CTxOut,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_raises_rpc_error,
+)
+
+class DataCarrierTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def test_transaction(self, tx, success):
+        tx_hex = tx.serialize().hex()
+
+        if success:
+            self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+            assert(tx.rehash() in self.nodes[0].getrawmempool(True))
+        else:
+            assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, "scriptpubkey", self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+
+    def create_null_data_transaction(self, script):
+        tx = self.wallet.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0)["tx"]
+        tx.vout.append(CTxOut(nValue=0, scriptPubKey=script))
+        tx.vout[0].nValue -= tx.get_vsize()  # simply pay 1sat/vbyte fee
+        return tx
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.node = self.nodes[0]
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.wallet.rescan_utxos()
+
+        self.log.info("Testing null data transaction with default -datacarrier and -datacarriersize values.")
+        script = CScript([OP_RETURN, b"Hello world!"])
+        tx = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx, success=True)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction larger than allowed by the default -datacarriersize value.")
+        data = b"Hello world!" * 10
+        script2 = CScript([OP_RETURN, data])
+        tx2 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script2)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx2, success=False)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction with -datacarrier=false.")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=["-datacarrier=false"])
+
+        tx3 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx3, success=False)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction with a small -datacarriersize value.")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=["-datacarrier=true", "-datacarriersize=5"])
+
+        tx4 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx4, success=False)
+

body:
nit: the [style guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/blob/master/test/functional/README.md#style-guidelines) suggest adding type hints
```suggestion
    def create_null_data_transaction(self, script: CScript) -> CTransaction:
```

```suggestion

```

body: The test now is using 3 nodes to avoid restarting, as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25792#pullrequestreview-1065378600. So `self.node ` is no longer being used. Thanks for the review.

+# Copyright (c) 2020-2021 The Bitcoin Core developers

+        if success:

+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2020-2021 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""Test datacarrier functionality"""
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_RETURN,
+)
+from test_framework.wallet import (
+    MiniWallet
+)
+from test_framework.messages import (
+    CTxOut,
+)
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_raises_rpc_error,
+)
+
+class DataCarrierTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 1
+
+    def test_transaction(self, tx, success):
+        tx_hex = tx.serialize().hex()
+
+        if success:
+            self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+            assert(tx.rehash() in self.nodes[0].getrawmempool(True))
+        else:
+            assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, "scriptpubkey", self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=self.nodes[0], tx_hex=tx_hex)
+
+    def create_null_data_transaction(self, script):
+        tx = self.wallet.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0)["tx"]
+        tx.vout.append(CTxOut(nValue=0, scriptPubKey=script))
+        tx.vout[0].nValue -= tx.get_vsize()  # simply pay 1sat/vbyte fee
+        return tx
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        self.node = self.nodes[0]
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.wallet.rescan_utxos()
+
+        self.log.info("Testing null data transaction with default -datacarrier and -datacarriersize values.")
+        script = CScript([OP_RETURN, b"Hello world!"])
+        tx = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx, success=True)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction larger than allowed by the default -datacarriersize value.")
+        data = b"Hello world!" * 10
+        script2 = CScript([OP_RETURN, data])
+        tx2 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script2)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx2, success=False)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction with -datacarrier=false.")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=["-datacarrier=false"])
+
+        tx3 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx3, success=False)
+
+        self.log.info("Testing a null data transaction with a small -datacarriersize value.")
+        self.restart_node(0, extra_args=["-datacarrier=true", "-datacarriersize=5"])
+
+        tx4 = self.create_null_data_transaction(script)
+
+        self.test_transaction(tx4, success=False)
+

body: AFAIK, we usually prefer multi-line over single-line imports in order to avoid potential merge conflicts. I opened a PR to hopefully get some consensus on how strict this (so far unwritten) rule should be followed: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25811

body: Would suggest to use the deterministic `random_bytes` helper instead (to be found in `test_framework.util`). (Background: also used the `urandom` approach for generating random data recently in a PR and got a review with good counter-arguments: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25625#discussion_r924540431)

+from test_framework.wallet import MiniWallet
+
+
+class DataCarrierTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 3
+        self.extra_args = [[], ["-datacarrier=false"], ["-datacarrier=true", "-datacarriersize=5"]]
+
+    def test_transaction(self, node: TestNode, tx: CTransaction, success: bool):
+        tx_hex = tx.serialize().hex()
+
+        if success:
+            self.wallet.sendrawtransaction(from_node=node, tx_hex=tx_hex)
+            assert tx.rehash() in node.getrawmempool(True), f'{tx_hex} not in mempool'
+        else:
+            assert_raises_rpc_error(-26, "scriptpubkey", self.wallet.sendrawtransaction, from_node=node, tx_hex=tx_hex)
+
+    def create_null_data_transaction(self, script: CScript) -> CTransaction:
+        tx = self.wallet.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0)["tx"]
+        tx.vout.append(CTxOut(nValue=0, scriptPubKey=script))
+        tx.vout[0].nValue -= tx.get_vsize()  # simply pay 1sat/vbyte fee
+        return tx
+
+    def run_test(self):
+        # Default setting for -datacarriersize: 80 bytes of data.
+        MAX_OP_RETURN_DATA_SIZE = 80
+
+        self.wallet = MiniWallet(self.nodes[0])
+        self.wallet.rescan_utxos()
+
+        data = os.urandom(MAX_OP_RETURN_DATA_SIZE)

+# Copyright (c) 2020-2021 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying

+    CTxOut,
+    CTransaction,
+    MAX_OP_RETURN_RELAY,
+)
+from test_framework.script import (
+    CScript,
+    OP_RETURN,
+)
+from test_framework.test_framework import BitcoinTestFramework
+from test_framework.test_node import TestNode
+from test_framework.util import (
+    assert_raises_rpc_error,
+    random_bytes,
+)
+from test_framework.wallet import MiniWallet
+
+
+class DataCarrierTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
+    def set_test_params(self):
+        self.num_nodes = 3
+        self.extra_args = [
+            [],
+            ["-datacarrier=false"],
+            ["-datacarrier=true", f"-datacarriersize={MAX_OP_RETURN_RELAY - 1}"]

body:
FYI for anyone else confused about this, see the docs of [`InterpretBool()`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/a6fc293c0a1f27ba1e573bfa16fd76d5f58988b2/src/util/system.cpp#L163-L167):

> non-numeric string values like "foo", return 0

so `-datacarrier=false` and `-datacarrier=true` all resolve to `-datacarrier=0`. 

As such, should be:

```py
            ["-datacarrier=0"],
            ["-datacarrier=1", f"-datacarriersize={MAX_OP_RETURN_RELAY - 1}"]
```

Good catch MarcoFalke!
